original_solution_mapping.L1: He has completed 125 pages + 16 pages = <<125+16=141>>141 pages of the book.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Rich has 372 pages - 141 pages = <<372-141=231>>231 pages left.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6255.
    Returns: the number of pages Rich has left to read to finish the book.
    """
    # L1
    pages_read = 125 # already read 125 pages of the book
    pages_skipped_maps = 16 # skipped the 16 pages of maps
    pages_completed = pages_read + pages_skipped_maps

    # L2
    total_pages = 372 # a 372-page book
    pages_left = total_pages - pages_completed

    # FA
    answer = pages_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has completed {pages_read} pages + {pages_skipped_maps} pages = <<{pages_read}+{pages_skipped_maps}={pages_completed}>>{pages_completed} pages of the book.
Rich has {total_pages} pages - {pages_completed} pages = <<{total_pages}-{pages_completed}={pages_left}>>{pages_left} pages left.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He has completed 16 pages + 16 pages = <<16+16=32>>32 pages of the book.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Rich has 372 pages - 32 pages = <<372-32=340>>340 pages left.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'pages_skipped_maps' (16) was used instead of 'pages_read' (125).
